net.sf.JRecord.def.IO.builders

Interface IDefineCsvFields


  • public interface IDefineCsvFields

    Interface for defining Csv field to a IOBuilder

     Usage:
 
     ICsvIOBuilder outIOBlbdr = JRecordInterface1.CSV
             .newIOBuilder(";", "\"")
                     .defineFields()
                         .addCsvField(FLD_SKU,   Type.ftChar, 0)
                         .addCsvField(FLD_STORE, Type.ftNumAnyDecimal, 0)
                         .addCsvField(FLD_DATE,  Type.ftNumAnyDecimal, 0)
                         .addCsvField(FLD_DEPT,  Type.ftNumAnyDecimal, 0)
                         .addCsvField(FLD_QTY,   Type.ftNumAnyDecimal, 0)
                         .addCsvField(FLD_PRICE, Type.ftNumAnyDecimal, 0)
                         .addCsvField(FLD_GST,   Type.ftNumAnyDecimal, 0)
                     .endOfRecord();
    Author:
    Bruce Martin

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IDefineCsvFields addCsvField(java.lang.String name, int type, int decimal)
      Add a Csv field to the schema
      ICsvIOBuilder endOfRecord()
      Marks the end of Field (or Column) Definition and returns the CsvIOBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • addCsvField

        IDefineCsvFields addCsvField(java.lang.String name,
                           int type,
                           int decimal)
        Add a Csv field to the schema
        Parameters:
        name - field name
        type - Field type, Most commonly it will be Type.ftChar; but you could use Type.ftNumAnyDecimal for a number or Type.ftNumLeftJustified for a type.
        decimal - how many decimals (for fixed length numeric types). Normally you should leave it as zero.
        Returns:
        this Schema-builder so other fields can be added

        Example: 

                     .defineFields()
                 .addCsvField(FLD_SKU,   Type.ftChar, 0)
                 .addCsvField(FLD_STORE, Type.ftNumAnyDecimal, 0)
             .endOfRecord();

      • endOfRecord

        ICsvIOBuilder endOfRecord()
        Marks the end of Field (or Column) Definition and returns the CsvIOBuilder
        Returns:
        CsvIOBuilder for further
